column1: vs. Sarsfield (H. M. Inspector of Taxes) Reported (Ch.D) [1985] STC 31; (CA)

column3: “….A  back  duty  enquiry  was  instituted  in  1970  and,  on  16th  March

column2: 1970, an Inspector of Taxes signed a certificate in volume 1 of his District

Assessment  books  stating 
that  he  had  made  assessments  on
administrators for the years 1960-61 to 1966-67 inclusive. The notices of
assessment  were  issued  on  16th  March  1970,  but  did  not  reach  the

column3: administrators until after 07th April 1970. It was common ground that the
assessments would be out of time unless made before 06th April 1970 by

column2: reason  of  the  provisions  of  section  34  and  section  40(1)  of  the  Taxes
Management Act of 1970. The administrators appealed.
